feed.title: Google Cloud: App Engine standard environment Java
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: App Engine standard environment Java

entry.content: Java 8 is deprecated. You won't be able to deploy Java 8 applications, even if your organization previously used an organization policy to re-enable deployments of legacy runtimes. Your existing Java 8 applications will continue to run and receive traffic. We recommend that you migrate to the latest supported version of Java.
entry.summary: The Java 8 runtime on App Engine standard is now deprecated and no new deployments will be allowed. Existing applications will continue to run, but migration to a newer Java version is strongly recommended.
entry.title: Feature: Java 8 Runtime Deprecation

entry.summary: The Java 25 runtime for App Engine standard environment is now in General Availability. This update provides access to the latest Java features and improvements for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: Java 25 Runtime Now Generally Available

entry.summary: Support for the Java 25 runtime is now available in preview. This allows you to use the latest Java version for your App Engine applications.
entry.title: Feature: Java 25 runtime now in preview

entry.content: To improve email security and ensure reliable, high-volume email delivery, migrate from the legacy Mail API to an SMTP-based email service, such as SendGrid, Mailgun, or Mailjet (Preview).
entry.summary: Migrate from the legacy Mail API to an SMTP-based email service for improved security and delivery.
entry.title: Feature: Email Delivery Enhancement

entry.content: To increase security, starting in March 2025, support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1.1 and earlier is deprecated. Update your application settings in the App Engine standard environment to use TLS version 1.2 and later, along with a corresponding secure set of cipher suites (Preview).
entry.summary: TLS 1.1 and earlier support deprecated in March 2025. Update your App Engine settings to use TLS 1.2 or later.
entry.title: Feature: TLS Security Update

entry.content: For new deployments, the URL Fetch API validates the certificate of the host it contacts by default.
entry.summary: The URL Fetch API validates host certificates by default for new deployments.
entry.title: Feature: URL Fetch API Certificate Validation
